page.title: 01Introduction to area.
page.content: Much of this area is sea. It is a popular place for the tourists and local walkers. The coastal footpath takes you along cliffs that are treacherous with some small caves which can be reached from above. The Red River runs through part of the area and there is some woodland, though most of the land is bleak and windswept in winter. Coombe Valley is a beautiful place in which most of the residents of this area live. Here there is a residential caraven site. The main industry is farming and there are some old quarries. There is also a caravan and campsite. Pat of the area is owned by the National Trust.
